name: Exotic Fish Quiz | Food & Drink | 5 Questions

questions.text: Opah, otherwise known as moonfish, is frequently caught near which of these islands?
questions.explanation:
Hawaii.

	A lean and gray meat is obtained from the opah, a traditional gourmet fish from Hawaii.  Considered a good luck fish, it was quite suitable as a gift during traditional times.  Now, it might most often be found as a selection in a sushi bar!

questions.text: Off what country's coast are you most likely to see Patagonian toothfish caught?
questions.explanation:
Chile.

	Patagonian toothfish, aka Chilean or Antarctic sea bass, is a denizen of the Southern Ocean.  Patagonia is a section of southern Argentina and Chile.  Formerly a common delicacy, this fish is now threatened and measures have been taken to protect it from becoming endangered.

questions.text: Chum, sockeye, and chinook are all species of what very common and well-loved food fish?
questions.explanation:
Salmon.

	Salmon fishing is very popular along the Pacific seaboard of North America, where these species are still quite abundant.  Salmon is a wonderful sushi fish, and is also used in a variety of wonderful dishes (I love salmon loaf!)

questions.text: It is called 'mahi-mahi' in Hawaii, but what is another common name for this delicious sea fish?
questions.explanation:
Dolphinfish.

	The dolphinfish should not be confused with the dolphin, which is a sea mammal.  Mahi-mahi is another traditional delicacy of Hawaii, very popular with natives and tourists alike.  The fish is also known as the 'dorado'.

questions.text: Wolf Eels are generally very large creatures, ranging to lengths of up to six feet.  Is it true that they are considered a delicacy in some countries?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Generally ranging up to 6 feet in length, and weighing up to 40 pounds, they are often seen off the coast of Japan.  The Japanese have made them a delicacy, along with many other eel varieties.  In fact, eels are considered gourmet cuisine along the entire Asian Pacific seaboard.  Thank you for trying this quiz on for size, I hope you enjoyed it!
